messages.subject: Magic
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/25/03 8:16:12 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/25/03 8:16:12 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< YOGA???? Maybe you'd better check that website again. I thought yoga
helped
the demons to enter! >>

Ah, Darla...you just reminded me of an interesting comment I heard from a
fundamentalist Christian once that still has me baffled (maybe she reads at
the demon website).
I taught a vegetarian/healthy cooking class and afterwards one of the women
and I got started on some topic that led to talking about meditation.
She said that she didn't believe in meditation because it opened you up to
evil spirits.
I asked her how she prayed to God if she didn't see it as a form of
meditation....she said only the kind of meditation where you "emptied"
yourself would make it possible for demon problems.
I about DIED!! That was tooooo weird. She really believed it. And all because
her dh told her so.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett

messages.messageBody:

How do you do that?
Sheila

messages.msgSnippet: COOL THANKS!!! I am always interested in things like this. :) If you come upon some others please send them this way. :) I never find the time to do all the
messages.messageBody:
COOL THANKS!!!
I am always interested in things like this. :)
If you come upon some others please send them this way. :)
I never find the time to do all the cool things out there.
To help out, I make our own clothes detergent. It saves a lot of
money and it really isn't hard and kinda fun.
Tracy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Magic
messages.msgSnippet: ***What is Fruitopia ? Like Dinotopia but with big peices of fruit???*** Shyrley , you re some kind of funny, woman. It will corrupt you entirely to know it
messages.messageBody:
***What is 'Fruitopia'?
Like Dinotopia but with big peices of fruit???***

Shyrley<G>, you're some kind of funny, woman.
It will corrupt you entirely to know it is a kind of beverage containing
mixed fruit flavors. Made by the Minute Maid company, I think. Not
100% juice but one of those mysterious juice style beverages.
But do be careful of the coils now.

Deb L, who's never actually tasted a Fruitopia anything.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Magic
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, what we got is very simple. We bought the plain, non-scented incense sticks and then different fragant oils. It s just a matter of soaking the sticks
messages.messageBody:
>>>Making your own incense? Wow, I've never heard or thought of doing that!
>>>Is there a website or two that you like for explaining what the process
>>>is?>>

Well, what we got is very simple. We bought the plain, non-scented incense
sticks and then different fragant oils. It's just a matter of soaking the
sticks in the oils and finding the fragrance or combo that you like.

We get our candlemaking supplies and incense stuff from Tradewinds
Fragrance. They're online. I think it's just TradewindsFragrance.com. I
couldn't find the incense instrustions. I'll ask Jon where that link is. I
did find this cool site though. It's got way more organic incense making.

http://www.peaceandharmony.org/articles,%20How%20To's/soapcandle.htm

Life is good.
~Mary

"The miracle is not to walk on water. The miracle is to walk on the green
earth, dwelling deeply in the present moment and feeling truly alive."

~ Thich Nhat Hanh

messages.subject: Re: Magic
messages.msgSnippet: Wow, I guess I m big-time doomed according to these folks -- I make my own candles, herbal-concoctions, incense, and essence oils, to name just a few things
messages.messageBody:
Wow, I guess I'm big-time doomed according to these folks -- I make
my own candles, herbal-concoctions, incense, and essence oils, to
name just a few things I'm sure they'd condemn.

Oh, and lets top of their list of no-no's, collect my $2 as I pass
their "straight to hell" sign, as I'm Pagan and a Crafter to boot.

Shesh...

... sad thing is, whether or not that particular site is a spoof,
there are plenty out there that aren't.

~ Becca

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Magic
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/25/03 2:45:34 PM, mkirk@columbus.rr.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/25/03 2:45:34 PM, mkirk@... writes:

<< Yes, I had a friend tell me that her church believed that yoga propared the

body for demonic possession!!!

>>

For a while there was a Christian karate class in town here, I heard. They
wanted their kids to learn karate but they were disturbed by the shinto and
Buddhist overtones, and they didn't want their kids bowing to anyone. So
they started a class that (I heard) involved starting with a prayer and ended
with something about making their bodies strong to serve Jesus or something.

I thought it was interesting and wondered why they didn't just do some kind
of other more European-based martial arts form. Fencing or something.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Magic
messages.msgSnippet: Oh boy, are we in trouble.  I m reading Harry Potter 4 to 10yodd (you know, owls,etc.), she loves catching frogs, 5yodd has a hobby horse unicorn.  The 12 and
messages.messageBody:
Oh boy, are we in trouble. I'm reading Harry Potter 4 to 10yodd (you know,
owls,etc.), she loves catching frogs, 5yodd has a hobby horse unicorn. The
12 and 10yogs have candle kits. We light candles sometimes and we're
Catholic. I'm sure we doing other dangerous things but I can't think of any
now.
Mary-NY

fingers for good luck, {or back to those birthday candles} making a
wish when you blow out your candles. You know all that comes from a
form of witchcraft.
Forget Christmas if you celebrate it, as a lot of our
holidays/traditions has a pagan origin.
Tracy

messages.subject: Magic
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/25/03 9:47:22 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/25/03 9:47:22 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< There was more but Internet Explorer MYSTERIOUSLY SHUT DOWN when I was
about
to find out what Wiccans don't want me to know about them. The fact that
Internet Explorer frequently shuts down my computer doesn't mean that it
wasn't significant THIS TIME. And I think I was going to find out how the
Trinity Broadcast Network was related to demons too. How is an ordinary
person to KNOW who to BELIEVE? >>

It was those damn DEMONS Joyce!! Don't you see it?
They shut your computer down so you can't find out the truth and be healed.
To think, I had a home filled with all these demon attractors....from
Pokemon, to prints to all those spirals (aka:coils) I paint in my artwork.
I'm practically holding a demon conference here!! I better warn visitors. I'd
hate to be responsible for inviting more possessions...it's too late for me I
fear.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Magic
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/25/03 5:15:38 AM, fetteroll@earthlink.net writes:  You do not have to worship any item for it to be idolatry. Just having these ...
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/25/03 5:15:38 AM, fetteroll@... writes:

<< > You do not have to worship any item for it to be idolatry. Just having
these
> things in your home give demons legal right to be in your home. >>

Demons have legal rights?
In the U.S. or everywhere?

Do female demons have the same legal rights as male demons?
If so, that's really not fair.

<<The Lord showed me that GYROMANCY, is on the "belly" of the POKEMON
> figures that are recently being released in BURGER KINGS. >>

JUST YESTERDAY I made waffles with my very-cool Powerpuff Girls waffle maker,
but it has a spiral design. Demons could have swirled right into the
stomachs of Kirby and Marty.

Holly didn't eat any. She's safe.


Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Magic
messages.msgSnippet: Shyrley  wrote: **Please tell me that this site is a spoof!!! There can t really be lunatics like that running around.** I don t
messages.messageBody:
Shyrley <shyrley.williams@...> wrote:



**Please tell me that this site is a spoof!!!

There can't really be lunatics like that running around.**



I don't know Shyrley,


a few years ago I ran into a homeschooled family who were pulling their kids out of our music and art school.
I asked the mother why? She informed me that she knew the school was only going to experience bad troubled times. She didn't want to be part of it.
I later found out that she had seen in the directors office that he had several candles around and liked to burn them! She thought he was worshiping the devil. And then on top of it she knew he was evil because he was gay.

I'm wondering how many candles I have in each room? 5 or 6? Ah, oh!

Kelli

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Magic
messages.msgSnippet: ... Lord, as ... Oh dear, oh dear. I have a few old dolls, staring at me now with their demonic eyes.  I don t have an owl but I have a small duck collection.
messages.messageBody:
>Any type of collection -
> dolls (roots come from voodoo), owls and frogs (abominations to the
Lord, as
> stated in the Bible), unicorns (lust and financial problems), etc.

Oh dear, oh dear.

I have a few old dolls, staring at me now with their demonic eyes. I
don't have an owl but I have a small duck collection. (could explain my
devilish delight with swimming) We have three swimming frogs and I can
see now they have a real problem with lust. I don't think I have any
unicorns but maybe in the frog tank...

I'm worried that my coffee mug collection may be causing my addiction to
caffeine.
I have a collection of dinner plates and I KNOW that's why I ate too much
last night.
There seems to be a collection of carrots in my crisper.
There is definitely a collection of toothbrushes in my medicine cabinet!
And Band-Aids!
I have cats. It might be a collection. I know they think they're Gods.
Could I be at risk?
And these BOOKS. There's even one about collecting pottery there, next
to the bible... Wait THREE bibles! A collection of bibles!

Maybe I need to exercise.

No problem, my yoga class is at ten thirty.

Deb L, collecting cat hair at the moment.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Magic
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ren, you re so naive! It s not just candles! ... ====== Here s the names of some demons. An exhaustive list is at:
messages.messageBody:
on 3/24/03 5:56 PM, starsuncloud@... at starsuncloud@... wrote:

> So THAT'S what I was doing wrong...sheesh, the things I just don't seem to
> learn very quickly. All these demons flying around, banging into walls and
> possessing everyone in our house, it's SO annoying!!
> And to think all I have to do is get rid of my candles. Begone foul demons,
> begone!!

Ren, you're so naive! It's not just candles!

> Look through your home as you pray and the Lord will let you know what items
> need to be destroyed that have become an idol to you. Any type of collection -
> dolls (roots come from voodoo), owls and frogs (abominations to the Lord, as
> stated in the Bible), unicorns (lust and financial problems), etc. You may
> have only one or two of these items, but they are just as deadly as a
> collection. We have read and heard countless testimonies of what these items
> can do. Dolls levitate, walk and talk; owls caused cancer and when destroyed
> the person was totally healed. Please pray and seek the Lord regarding which
> items you must destroy. With pictures of movie stars you form a soul tie. One
> example is of a woman who came to us for DELIVERANCE from men and drugs. As I
> was praying for her the Lord impressed that the picture of Marilyn Monroe that
> was hanging above her bed was part of the problem. Marilyn Monroe had trouble
> with men and drugs and she died because of it.
...
> You do not have to worship any item for it to be idolatry. Just having these
> things in your home give demons legal right to be in your home.
====
> "I want to give you some information about two demons that were recently
> revealed to me. The first one's name is "GYROMANCY". GYROMANCY is appearing on
> the new FRUITOPIA bottled fruit drink. GYROMANCY is a COIL like the coil on
> your electric stove. GYROMANCY'S design is to keep you moving in "circles", so
> you never accomplish your goals. GYROMANCY is the COIL inside the picture of
> the palm readers hand. GYROMANCY is the COIL that hypnotists have you stare at
> to put you OUT. GYROMANCY unlike the gyroscope tries to keep you OUT OF
> BALANCE. The Lord showed me that GYROMANCY, is on the "belly" of the POKEMON
> figures that are recently being released in BURGER KINGS. POKEMON in Japanese
> means "POCKET MONSTER". These little toys come in all shapes, one is a
> UNICORN, there are gold plated tokens and secret boxes to place the figures in
> which draws the children to buy them. I have heard children in stores, BEGGING
> their parents for POKEMON gameboys, videos and games... THIS IS OUT OF
> CONTROL... (TAKE A BREATH)
>
> The "DARK BLUE" POKEMON figure has a COIL on his belly. The COIL is the OPEN
> DOOR to the DEMONIC WITCHCRAFT attack being brought into homes. The COIL is
> also appearing on the BURGER KING sacks at present and I am seeing this COIL
> on many products in the store.
>
> LAWRYS SEASON SALT has it! Isn't this bizarre???? We were even in Red Lobster
> and the plates we were being served on, has the spiral COIL throughout the
> center and on the outside edge were 8 fish with spirals in their belly.
======
Here's the names of some demons. An exhaustive list is at:
http://www.demonbuster.com/demonlist.html

* BITTERNESS
* PREJUDICE
* ANGER
* HATRED
* MURDER
* RESENTMENT
* RETALIATION
* TEMPER
* UNFORGIVENESS
* VIOLENCE
* INEPTNESS
* SHYNESS
* FANTASY
* HEADACHE
* PROCRASTINATION <-- Yikes!
* TAROT
* DUNGEONS AND DRAGONS
* CRYING
* SORROW
* ACNE
====
Paisley print is something you see on ties, shirts, blouses, dresses,
curtains, rugs, furniture, etc. If you wear it, you may be carrying around
some demons, which could be the cause of some of your "problems".

In DELIVERANCE, you stay away from many things because of the ORIGIN. In the
PAISLEY PRINT PATTERN, you have a connection with

CATHOLICS
THE COUNTRY OF INDIA (WITH ALL THEIR GODS)
GOAT HAIR (GOAT IS THE SYMBOL FOR THE DEVIL)
MUSLIMS
PRAYER RUGS
JESUITS
CULTS
SEERS
MAGICIANS
OCCULT
(http://www.demonbuster.com/paisley.html tells you how paisleys are
connected to these things.)
=====
There was more but Internet Explorer MYSTERIOUSLY SHUT DOWN when I was about
to find out what Wiccans don't want me to know about them. The fact that
Internet Explorer frequently shuts down my computer doesn't mean that it
wasn't significant THIS TIME. And I think I was going to find out how the
Trinity Broadcast Network was related to demons too. How is an ordinary
person to KNOW who to BELIEVE?

Joyce

messages.subject: Magic
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/24/03 3:18:42 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/24/03 3:18:42 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
Boy oh boy. That site would be funny if it were a spoof.
Guess I'm doomed, what with using candles and incense daily. Ho hum. >>

So THAT'S what I was doing wrong...sheesh, the things I just don't seem to
learn very quickly. All these demons flying around, banging into walls and
possessing everyone in our house, it's SO annoying!!
And to think all I have to do is get rid of my candles. Begone foul demons,
begone!!
Ah, but then I couldn't keep my peace vigil candle going in the window...oh
well. I guess we'll just have to keep some demons around anyway. sigh.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
